drugs.name: Panadol
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.sideEffects: Rare: skin rash, nausea. Overdose can cause liver damage.
drugs.warnings: Do not exceed maximum daily dose. Avoid alcohol consumption.
drugs.pregnancyCategory: Safe during pregnancy when used as directed
drugs.contraindications: Severe liver disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Brufen
drugs.timing: Take with food or milk to reduce stomach upset
drugs.usage: Pain relief, inflammation, and fever reduction
drugs.sideEffects: Stomach upset, heartburn, dizziness, headache
drugs.warnings: May increase risk of heart attack or stroke. Avoid if you have stomach ulcers.
drugs.interactions: Aspirin, blood thinners, blood pressure medications
drugs.contraindications: History of stomach ulcers, severe kidney disease, heart disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, recommended to take with milk or food

drugs.name: Augmentin
drugs.timing: Take at the start of a meal
drugs.sideEffects: Diarrhea, nausea, skin rash
drugs.warnings: Complete the full course even if symptoms improve. May cause antibiotic resistance if misused.
drugs.interactions: Blood thinners, oral contraceptives may be less effective
drugs.contraindications: Penicillin allergy, severe liver disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Flagyl
drugs.timing: Take with or after food
drugs.sideEffects: Metallic taste, nausea, headache, dark urine
drugs.warnings: AVOID ALCOHOL completely - can cause severe reaction (vomiting, rapid heart rate)
drugs.contraindications: Alcohol consumption, first trimester pregnancy
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Disprin
drugs.timing: Take with food or milk
drugs.usage: Pain relief, fever reduction, blood thinning
drugs.sideEffects: Stomach upset, bleeding tendency, ringing in ears
drugs.warnings: Not for children under 16 (risk of Reye's syndrome). Increases bleeding risk.
drugs.contraindications: Stomach ulcers, bleeding disorders, children under 16
drugs.withMilk: Yes, recommended to reduce stomach irritation

drugs.name: Risek
drugs.timing: 30 minutes before breakfast on empty stomach
drugs.sideEffects: Headache, nausea, diarrhea, stomach pain
drugs.warnings: Long-term use may reduce calcium absorption. Take before meals.
drugs.contraindications: Severe liver disease
drugs.withMilk: Take on empty stomach, avoid milk at time of taking

drugs.name: Arinac
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dry mouth, dizziness
drugs.warnings: May cause drowsiness - avoid driving. Not for long-term use.
drugs.interactions: Other cold medications, sedatives, blood pressure medications
drugs.contraindications: Severe high blood pressure, heart disease, glaucoma
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Glucophage
drugs.timing: Take with meals to reduce stomach upset
drugs.sideEffects: Nausea, diarrhea, stomach upset, metallic taste
drugs.warnings: Start with low dose. Avoid alcohol. Risk of lactic acidosis in kidney disease.
drugs.contraindications: Severe kidney disease, liver disease, heart failure
drugs.withMilk: Yes, take with food or milk

drugs.name: Norvasc
drugs.timing: Same time each day, with or without food
drugs.sideEffects: Swelling of ankles, headache, dizziness, flushing
drugs.warnings: Do not stop suddenly. May cause dizziness - rise slowly from sitting.
drugs.contraindications: Severe low blood pressure, severe heart disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Lipitor
drugs.timing: Evening, with or without food
drugs.sideEffects: Muscle pain, headache, nausea
drugs.warnings: Report muscle pain immediately. Avoid grapefruit juice.
drugs.contraindications: Pregnancy, breastfeeding, active liver disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Ventolin
drugs.timing: When experiencing breathing difficulty
drugs.sideEffects: Tremors, rapid heartbeat, nervousness
drugs.warnings: If using more than usual, see doctor. Rinse mouth after use.
drugs.contraindications: None major, use with caution in heart disease
drugs.withMilk: N/A (inhaler)

drugs.name: Cipro
drugs.timing: 2 hours before or 6 hours after dairy products or antacids
drugs.sideEffects: Nausea, diarrhea, dizziness, sun sensitivity
drugs.warnings: Avoid sun exposure. May cause tendon rupture. Complete full course.
drugs.interactions: Dairy products, calcium, iron, antacids (reduces absorption)
drugs.contraindications: Children, pregnancy, tendon problems
drugs.withMilk: NO - take 2 hours before or 6 hours after dairy

drugs.name: Ponstan
drugs.timing: Take with food
drugs.sideEffects: Stomach upset, diarrhea, dizziness
drugs.warnings: Not for long-term use (max 7 days). Take with food.
drugs.interactions: Blood thinners, other NSAIDs, blood pressure medications
drugs.contraindications: Stomach ulcers, kidney disease, pregnancy (third trimester)
drugs.withMilk: Yes, take with food or milk

drugs.name: Xanax
drugs.timing: With or without food
drugs.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dizziness, memory problems
drugs.warnings: Highly addictive. Do not stop suddenly. Avoid alcohol. May impair driving.
drugs.contraindications: Pregnancy, alcohol use, severe respiratory problems
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Nexium
drugs.timing: 1 hour before meals, preferably morning
drugs.sideEffects: Headache, nausea, diarrhea, stomach pain
drugs.warnings: Long-term use may affect calcium absorption and bone health.
drugs.contraindications: Severe liver disease
drugs.withMilk: Take on empty stomach, avoid milk at time of taking

drugs.name: Zantac
drugs.timing: Before meals or at bedtime
drugs.sideEffects: Headache, dizziness, constipation or diarrhea
drugs.warnings: Note: Some ranitidine products were recalled due to contamination concerns. Consult your doctor.
drugs.contraindications: Kidney disease (adjust dose)
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Calpol
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.usage: Fever and pain relief in children
drugs.sideEffects: Rare: allergic reactions
drugs.warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose. Calculate dose based on child's weight.
drugs.contraindications: Severe liver disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be mixed with milk for children

drugs.name: Lasix
drugs.timing: Morning (to avoid nighttime urination)
drugs.usage: Water retention, high blood pressure, heart failure
drugs.sideEffects: Frequent urination, dizziness, low potassium
drugs.warnings: May cause dehydration and low potassium. Monitor electrolytes.
drugs.interactions: Blood pressure medications, lithium, diabetes medications
drugs.contraindications: Severe kidney disease, anuria
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Inderal
drugs.timing: With or without food, but be consistent
drugs.usage: High blood pressure, anxiety, migraine prevention, tremors
drugs.sideEffects: Fatigue, cold hands/feet, dizziness, slow heart rate
drugs.warnings: Do not stop suddenly (may worsen heart problems). May mask low blood sugar in diabetics.
drugs.interactions: Asthma medications, diabetes medications, other blood pressure drugs
drugs.contraindications: Asthma, severe heart block, very slow heart rate
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Diamox
drugs.timing: With food to reduce stomach upset
drugs.sideEffects: Tingling in hands/feet, increased urination, taste changes
drugs.warnings: Drink plenty of water. May cause sun sensitivity.
drugs.contraindications: Kidney disease, liver disease, low sodium/potassium
drugs.withMilk: Yes, take with food or milk

drugs.name: Motilium
drugs.timing: 15-30 minutes before meals
drugs.usage: Nausea, vomiting, bloating, delayed stomach emptying
drugs.sideEffects: Dry mouth, headache, diarrhea
drugs.warnings: Not for long-term use. May affect heart rhythm in high doses.
drugs.contraindications: Gastrointestinal bleeding, prolactinoma, heart rhythm problems
drugs.withMilk: Take before meals on relatively empty stomach

drugs.name: Telfast
drugs.timing: With water on empty stomach
drugs.sideEffects: Headache, drowsiness (mild), nausea
drugs.warnings: Non-drowsy antihistamine. Avoid fruit juices which reduce absorption.
drugs.contraindications: Severe kidney disease
drugs.withMilk: Avoid milk/fruit juice - take with water only

drugs.name: Cefspan
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.sideEffects: Diarrhea, nausea, stomach pain
drugs.warnings: Complete full course. May cause antibiotic resistance if misused.
drugs.contraindications: Penicillin/cephalosporin allergy
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Rohypnol
drugs.timing: N/A
drugs.sideEffects: Extreme drowsiness, memory loss, impaired judgment
drugs.warnings: HIGHLY CONTROLLED. Risk of abuse and dependence. Known as date rape drug.
drugs.contraindications: Most uses are illegal. Requires special prescription.
drugs.withMilk: N/A - controlled substance

drugs.name: Avil
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dry mouth, blurred vision
drugs.warnings: May cause drowsiness - avoid driving. Not for long-term use.
drugs.contraindications: Glaucoma, prostate enlargement, severe respiratory disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Gravinate
drugs.timing: 30 minutes before travel
drugs.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dry mouth, blurred vision
drugs.warnings: Causes drowsiness - do not drive. Avoid alcohol.
drugs.contraindications: Glaucoma, asthma, prostate problems
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Coartem
drugs.timing: With fatty food or milk to increase absorption
drugs.sideEffects: Headache, dizziness, nausea, muscle pain
drugs.warnings: Complete full 3-day course. Take with fatty food for better absorption.
drugs.contraindications: Severe heart rhythm problems
drugs.withMilk: YES - strongly recommended to take with milk or fatty food

drugs.name: Daonil
drugs.frequency: Once or twice daily with meals
drugs.timing: With breakfast or main meal
drugs.sideEffects: Low blood sugar, weight gain, nausea
drugs.warnings: Monitor blood sugar. Risk of hypoglycemia (low blood sugar). Carry glucose source.
drugs.contraindications: Type 1 diabetes, severe kidney/liver disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, take with meals

drugs.name: Bactrim
drugs.timing: With plenty of water
drugs.sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, skin rash, sun sensitivity
drugs.warnings: Drink plenty of water. Avoid sun exposure. Complete full course.
drugs.interactions: Blood thinners, diabetes medications, certain diuretics
drugs.contraindications: Sulfa drug allergy, severe kidney/liver disease, pregnancy (late term)
drugs.withMilk: Yes, but drink plenty of water

drugs.name: Librax
drugs.timing: Before meals and at bedtime
drugs.usage: Irritable bowel syndrome, stomach ulcers, anxiety with GI symptoms
drugs.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation
drugs.warnings: Habit-forming. May cause drowsiness. Do not stop suddenly.
drugs.contraindications: Pregnancy, glaucoma, prostate enlargement, severe liver disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Azomax
drugs.timing: 1 hour before or 2 hours after meals
drugs.sideEffects: Nausea, diarrhea, stomach pain, headache
drugs.warnings: Complete full course. May cause irregular heart rhythm in some patients.
drugs.contraindications: Severe liver disease, previous allergic reaction to macrolide antibiotics
drugs.withMilk: Avoid milk/dairy - take 1-2 hours before or after

drugs.name: Zyrtec
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.usage: Allergies, sneezing, runny nose, hives, itching
drugs.sideEffects: Mild drowsiness, dry mouth, fatigue, headache
drugs.warnings: May cause drowsiness initially. Avoid alcohol. Use caution when driving.
drugs.contraindications: Severe kidney disease (reduce dose)
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Losec
drugs.timing: 30 minutes before breakfast on empty stomach
drugs.usage: Acid reflux, gastritis, stomach ulcers, GERD
drugs.sideEffects: Headache, nausea, diarrhea, stomach pain, dizziness
drugs.warnings: Long-term use may reduce calcium and magnesium absorption. Not for immediate relief.
drugs.interactions: Blood thinners, certain antifungals, HIV medications
drugs.contraindications: Severe liver disease, osteoporosis (long-term use)
drugs.withMilk: Take on empty stomach - avoid milk at time of taking

drugs.name: Neurobion
drugs.timing: After meals
drugs.usage: Vitamin B deficiency, nerve pain, neuropathy, fatigue
drugs.sideEffects: Rare: mild nausea, skin rash, yellow urine (B2)
drugs.warnings: Generally safe. Excessive B6 can cause nerve damage with very high doses.
drugs.contraindications: None major, allergy to any component
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Hydryllin
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.sideEffects: Drowsiness, dizziness, nausea, rapid heartbeat
drugs.warnings: May cause significant drowsiness. Avoid driving or operating machinery.
drugs.contraindications: Severe heart disease, glaucoma, prostate enlargement
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Surbex Z
drugs.timing: After meal
drugs.usage: General weakness, immunity support, zinc deficiency, hair/skin health
drugs.sideEffects: Rare: stomach upset, metallic taste
drugs.warnings: Safe for long-term use. Avoid taking on empty stomach.
drugs.contraindications: Wilson's disease (copper metabolism disorder)
drugs.withMilk: Yes, take with food or milk

drugs.name: Levofloxacin
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.usage: Respiratory, urinary tract, and skin infections
drugs.sideEffects: Nausea, diarrhea, headache, dizziness, sun sensitivity
drugs.warnings: Avoid sun exposure. May cause tendon rupture (rare). Complete full course.
drugs.interactions: Antacids, dairy products, iron supplements (reduces absorption)
drugs.contraindications: Children under 18, pregnancy, tendon problems, myasthenia gravis
drugs.withMilk: Avoid dairy 2 hours before/after - take with water

drugs.name: Duphaston
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.usage: Hormonal imbalance, irregular periods, endometriosis, pregnancy support
drugs.sideEffects: Headache, nausea, breast tenderness, mood changes
drugs.warnings: Take under gynecologist supervision only. Do not use for contraception.
drugs.contraindications: Breast cancer, unexplained vaginal bleeding, severe liver disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Amaryl
drugs.timing: Before or with breakfast
drugs.sideEffects: Low blood sugar (hypoglycemia), nausea, dizziness, weight gain
drugs.warnings: Monitor blood sugar regularly. Avoid skipping meals. Carry glucose source.
drugs.contraindications: Type 1 diabetes, diabetic ketoacidosis, severe kidney/liver disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, take with breakfast/food

drugs.name: Concor
drugs.timing: Morning, with or without food
drugs.usage: High blood pressure, heart disease, heart failure
drugs.sideEffects: Fatigue, cold hands/feet, slow heartbeat, dizziness, headache
drugs.warnings: Do not stop suddenly. Monitor blood pressure regularly. May worsen asthma.
drugs.interactions: Diabetes medications, other blood pressure drugs, calcium channel blockers
drugs.contraindications: Asthma, severe heart block, very slow heart rate, severe heart failure
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Enalapril
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.usage: Hypertension, heart failure, kidney protection in diabetes
drugs.sideEffects: Dry cough, dizziness, headache, fatigue, low blood pressure
drugs.warnings: May cause persistent dry cough. Monitor blood pressure and kidney function.
drugs.interactions: Potassium supplements, NSAIDs, lithium, other blood pressure medications
drugs.contraindications: Pregnancy, history of angioedema, severe kidney disease
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Clopidogrel
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.usage: Blood thinner for heart attack/stroke prevention, after stent placement
drugs.sideEffects: Easy bruising, bleeding, nosebleeds, stomach upset
drugs.warnings: Increases bleeding risk. Inform doctors/dentists before procedures.
drugs.interactions: Aspirin, NSAIDs, warfarin, proton pump inhibitors (may reduce effect)
drugs.contraindications: Active bleeding, severe liver disease, planned surgery
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Prednisolone
drugs.timing: Morning with food
drugs.usage: Inflammation, asthma, allergies, autoimmune diseases, organ transplant
drugs.sideEffects: Weight gain, mood changes, increased appetite, high blood sugar, bone loss
drugs.warnings: Do not stop abruptly. Follow tapering schedule. May increase infection risk.
drugs.interactions: NSAIDs (stomach ulcer risk), diabetes medications, vaccines, diuretics
drugs.pregnancyCategory: Use only if benefits outweigh risks
drugs.contraindications: Active infections, recent vaccinations with live vaccines
drugs.withMilk: Yes, take with food or milk to reduce stomach upset

drugs.name: Crestor
drugs.timing: Evening, can be taken with or without food
drugs.usage: High cholesterol, high triglycerides, cardiovascular disease prevention
drugs.sideEffects: Muscle pain, headache, nausea, abdominal pain, weakness
drugs.warnings: Report muscle pain immediately. Avoid alcohol. Monitor liver function.
drugs.interactions: Grapefruit juice, certain antibiotics, antifungals, HIV medications
drugs.pregnancyCategory: NOT safe in pregnancy or breastfeeding
drugs.contraindications: Pregnancy, breastfeeding, active liver disease, unexplained muscle pain
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Klaricid
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.usage: Respiratory infections, skin infections, H. pylori treatment
drugs.sideEffects: Nausea, diarrhea, stomach pain, abnormal taste, headache
drugs.warnings: Complete the full course. May cause irregular heart rhythm in some patients.
drugs.interactions: Statins (muscle damage risk), blood thinners, certain heart medications
drugs.pregnancyCategory: Avoid in first trimester if possible
drugs.contraindications: Previous allergic reaction, severe liver disease, certain heart conditions
drugs.withMilk: Yes, can be taken with milk

drugs.name: Tazocin
drugs.timing: Intravenous administration by healthcare professional
drugs.usage: Severe bacterial infections (pneumonia, sepsis, intra-abdominal infections)
drugs.sideEffects: Injection site reactions, diarrhea, rash, low potassium
drugs.warnings: Hospital use only. Administer under medical supervision. Monitor kidney function.
drugs.contraindications: Penicillin allergy, cephalosporin allergy
drugs.withMilk: N/A (IV medication)

drugs.name: Avamys
drugs.timing: Morning, preferably same time each day
drugs.usage: Nasal allergies, allergic rhinitis, sinusitis symptoms
drugs.sideEffects: Nosebleeds, nasal irritation, headache, sore throat
drugs.warnings: Use regularly for best effect (takes 2-3 days). Avoid spraying into eyes.
drugs.contraindications: Recent nasal surgery, nasal infection
drugs.withMilk: N/A (nasal spray)

drugs.name: Panadol Extra
drugs.timing: Can be taken with or without food
drugs.usage: Headache, migraine, body pain, dental pain
drugs.sideEffects: Rare: nausea, jitteriness (from caffeine)
drugs.warnings: Avoid other caffeine sources. Do not exceed maximum daily dose. Avoid alcohol.
drugs.interactions: Warfarin, other paracetamol products, caffeine-containing products
drugs.pregnancyCategory: Safe during pregnancy (limit caffeine intake overall)
drugs.contraindications: Severe liver disease, caffeine sensitivity
drugs.withMilk: Yes, but avoid excessive caffeine from other sources
